Type.Name: Colormap

TypeSignature.Value: public class Colormap : GLib.Object, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A structure that contains different colors.
Disposes the resources associated with the object.

Docs.returns: An instance of Colormap, wrapping the C object.

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Creates a new colormap for the given visual.
Docs.param: if true, the newly created colormap will be a private colormap, and all colors in it will be allocated for the applications use.

Docs.summary: Gets the system's default colormap for the default screen.
Docs.returns: The system's default colormap for the default screen.

Docs.summary: Returns the visual for which a given colormap was created.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool AllocColor (ref Gdk.Color color, bool writeable, bool best_match);

Docs.summary: Allocates a single color from a colormap.
Docs.param: The color to allocate. On return the pixel field will be filled in if allocation succeeds.
If true, the color is allocated writeable (their values can later be changed using ). Writeable colors cannot be shared between applications.
If true, GDK will attempt to do matching against existing colors if the color cannot be allocated as requested.

Docs.summary: Gets the screen for which this colormap was created.
Docs.returns: The screen for which this colormap was created.

MemberSignature.Value: public void QueryColor (ulong pixel, ref Gdk.Color result);

Docs.summary: Locates the RGB color in the colormap corresponding to the given hardware pixel.
Docs.param: Pixel value in hardware display format.
with red, green, blue fields initialized.
Docs.remarks: Pixel must be a valid pixel in the colormap; it's a programmer error to call his function with a pixel which is not in the colormap. Hardware pixels are normally obtained from , or from a . (A contains image data in hardware format, a contains image data in a canonical 24-bit RGB format.)

MemberSignature.Value: public void FreeColors (Gdk.Color[] colors, int ncolors);

Docs.param: The number of colors in colors.

MemberSignature.Value: public int AllocColors (Gdk.Color[] colors, int ncolors, bool writeable, bool best_match, bool [] success);

Docs.param: The color values to allocate. On return, the pixel values for allocated colors will be filled in.
The number of colors in colors.
If true, the colors are allocated writeable (their values can later be changed using ). Writeable colors cannot be shared between applications.
If true, GDK will attempt to do matching against existing colors if the colors cannot be allocated as requested.
An array of length ncolors. On return, this indicates whether the corresponding color in colors was sucessfully allocated or not.
Docs.returns: The number of colors that were not successfully allocated.

Docs.remarks: This is a constructor used by derivative types of that would have their own GLib.GType assigned to it. This is not typically used by C# code.
